skill.name: bioservices
skill.description: Unified Python interface to 40+ bioinformatics services. Use when querying multiple databases (UniProt, KEGG, ChEMBL, Reactome) in a single workflow with consistent API. Best for cross-database analysis, ID mapping across services. For quick single-database lookups use gget; for sequence/file manipulation use biopython.
skill.summary: Unified Python interface to 40+ bioinformatics services. Use when querying multiple databases (UniPr...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI

security_audit.summary: All 521 static findings are false positives. Scanner misidentified markdown code block delimiters as shell commands, biological database identifiers as cryptographic algorithms, and legitimate API queries to bioinformatics databases as system reconnaissance. The skill is a legitimate scientific library interface.

content.value_statement: Query 40+ biological databases including UniProt, KEGG, and ChEMBL with a consistent Python API. Simplifies cross-database analysis and identifier conversion for bioinformatics research.
actual_capabilities: Query UniProt for protein sequences and annotations
Access KEGG pathways and metabolic data
Search compound databases like ChEMBL and ChEBI
Retrieve Gene Ontology terms and annotations
limitations: Requires internet access to query remote databases
Rate limits apply per database service
Some databases require email registration for API access

use_cases.title: Cross-database protein analysis
use_cases.description: Retrieve protein data from UniProt, map to KEGG pathways, and analyze interactions in one workflow.

use_cases.title: Compound identifier mapping
use_cases.description: Convert compound IDs between KEGG, ChEMBL, and ChEBI databases for chemical research.

use_cases.title: Pathway network extraction
use_cases.description: Extract protein interaction networks from KEGG pathways for downstream network analysis.

prompt_templates.title: Find protein sequence
prompt_templates.prompt: Use BioServices to find the UniProt entry for protein ZAP70 and retrieve its FASTA sequence.

prompt_templates.title: Map gene identifiers
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert the UniProt ID P43403 to its corresponding KEGG gene ID using BioServices mapping.

prompt_templates.title: Analyze pathways
prompt_templates.prompt: Use BioServices to get all pathways for human containing gene 7535 and extract the interaction network.

prompt_templates.title: Cross-reference compounds
prompt_templates.prompt: Search KEGG for compound Geldanamycin, then use UniChem to find its ChEMBL and ChEBI identifiers.

output: Pathways: hsa04660 (B cell receptor signaling), hsa04650

output_examples.input: Convert compound IDs from KEGG to ChEMBL

best_practices: Set verbose=False to reduce logging output for cleaner results
Add delays between batch requests to respect API rate limits
Always specify organism codes to avoid ambiguity
anti_patterns: Making thousands of requests without rate limiting
Using ambiguous gene names without specifying organism
Skipping error handling for network-dependent operations

faq.question: Which databases are supported?
faq.answer: 40+ databases including UniProt, KEGG, ChEMBL, ChEBI, PDB, Reactome, BioMart, and ArrayExpress.

faq.question: Do I need API keys?
faq.answer: Most databases are free. NCBI services require a valid email address for BLAST searches.

faq.question: How to handle rate limits?
faq.answer: Add time.sleep between requests and use chunk_size parameter for batch operations.

faq.question: Can I convert batch identifiers?
faq.answer: Yes, use the batch_id_converter.py script or implement chunked mapping with 50-100 IDs per request.

faq.question: What output formats are supported?
faq.answer: FASTA, XML, tab-separated, JSON, and database-specific formats depending on the service.

faq.question: How to get pathway interactions?
faq.answer: Use KEGG.pathway2sif() or parse_kgml_pathway() to extract protein-protein interaction networks.
